question: E-mail has had a huge impact on professional and social communication,but this impact has been negative as well as positive. Do the disadvantages of usinge-mail outweigh the advantages
text: It is true that E-mail continues to be an imperative communication tool nowadays.However, because the uses of E-mail are general and multi-functional, it can be used in all areas.E-mail has affected our lives in a positive way, and also in a negative way. Some people enjoy the benefits while the drawbacks have a huge effect on others.

To begin with, it is true that E-mail has convenient our communication, and it has been used in a variety of areas.For example, international firms tend to use E-mail to contact each other, they use it for making important decisions. Moreover, it is not appropriate that students to contact lecturers with phones,  instead of using E-mail is always better. Furthermore, in some cases, if it is necessary, mail can be collected as evidence in courts. In addition, employees can do their work through E-mail.As result, because of the convenience of this,people's time has been saved and has increased efficiencies in offices, and productivity and has a positive effect on international relationships between countries.
On the other hand, it is clear that it also has a negative impact on our lives. For instance, we can receive an extremely large amount of advertisements from some companies, which disturb our lives.
